alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Childress; Cottle; Crosby; Dickens; Floyd; Hall; King; Motley; Swisher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 08 at 2:51AM CDT until April 08 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE FAR SOUTHERN PANHANDLE, THE EASTERN SOUTH PLAINS, AND MOST OF THE ROLLING PLAINS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE FAR SOUTHERN PANHANDLE, THE SOUTH PLAINS, AND THE ROLLING PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 10 AM this morning to 5 PM CDT this afternoon. A Fire Weather Watch is in also in effect from Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * Winds...Northwest at 15 to 20 mph at the 20 foot level. Winds become variable around sunset shifting to the south late this evening. * Humidity...As low as 7 percent. * Fuels...Extremely dry. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are imminent or already occurring. These conditions can create rapid wildfire growth. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Monitor later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Briscoe; Childress; Cottle; Crosby; Dickens; Floyd; Hall; King; Motley; Swisher
